intro: Luetzelburgia freire-allemanii, commonly known as the Freire-Alléman's luetzelburgia, is a flowering plant native to South America, specifically Brazil. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and other toxic plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It is a shrub or small tree, often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
